org.fluidity.composition

Annotation Type ServiceProvider


  • @Documented
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=TYPE)
 @Inherited
 @Qualifier(value=NONE)
public @interface ServiceProvider
    Declares that the annotated class, or implementing classes of the annotated interface, are service providers in the JAR File Specification's meaning of the term. As long as the org.fluidity.maven:composition-maven-plugin Maven plugin is used in the host project, such classes can be discovered in any given class loader by the ComponentDiscovery component, or in case the type() parameter is not specified, using the service provider discovery mechanism built in the Java platform.

    Usage

     @ServiceProvider
 public final class MyContractImpl implements Contract {
   …
 }

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      Class[] api
      Specifies the interfaces that this service provider implements.
      String type
      Specifies what type of service provider the annotated class is.

    • Element Detail

      • api

        public abstract Class[] api
        Specifies the interfaces that this service provider implements. For abstract classes or interfaces the value defaults to the annotated class itself. In other cases the annotation must specify a value.
        Returns:
        an array of Class objects.
        Default:
        {}

      • type

        public abstract String type
        Specifies what type of service provider the annotated class is. The Java platform uses the default value, "services", using which requires the class to be public and to have a public zero-argument constructor.

        The default type is understood by ServiceLoader while all types are understood by ComponentDiscovery.

        Returns:
        the service provider type.
        Default:
        "services"
